title: Blitz Package: Preview capsules
text:
JOSH FRIEDMAN, @JFriedman57 8:24 p.m. EDT October 22, 2015 Blitz package: Preview capsules 14 CONNECT 13 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Buena (5-1) at Pleasantville (0-6) 
When: Friday, 7 p.m. 
Where: 701 Mill Road, Pleasantville 
Coaches: Buena: Jonathan Caputo (5th season, 68-71); Pleasantville: Chris Sacco (1st season, 0-6). 
Last week: Buena won its fourth straight game, escaping Mainland with a 14-13 victory on Oct. 16. LJ Maldonado forced a Mustang fumble with 1:33 remaining in the game to seal the win. The Chiefs trailed 10-0 at halftime, but Quadir Albright got them on the scoreboard with a 48-yard touchdown run in the third quarter. He scored on a 15-yard scamper in the fourth to give Buena the lead. ... Pleasantville lost to Holy Spirit 37-12 on Oct. 16, dropping its 16th straight game. The Greyhounds last win was a 15-14 triumph over Ocean City in their final game of 2013. Edward Sierra had a 38-yard fumble return for a touchdown to get Pleasantville on the board against Holy Spirit. Daniel Samuel added a 58-yard TD run later in the game. 
Hammonton (6-0) at Delsea (6-0) 
When: Friday, 7 p.m. 
Where: John A. Oberg Field, 242 Fries Mill Road, Franklinville 
Coaches: Hammonton: Jim Raso (1st season, 6-0); Delsea: Sal Marchese (23rd season, 179-60-1). 
Last week: Hammonton defeated Moorestown 42-3 on Oct. 16 to stay unbeaten under first-year coach Jim Raso. Zachary Barnard rushed for 89 yards and three touchdowns, quarterback Malachi Winters scored as both a runner and a receiver and Mitchell Vitali also found pay dirt. … Delsea also stayed perfect with a 55-6 rout of Eastern on Oct. 16. The Crusaders scored 42 first-half points in the win. Rashaad Williams rushed for 182 yards and two scores on just 10 attempts, while Dylan Landi added a pair of touchdowns as well. 
St. Augustine (6-0) at Egg Harbor Twp. (3-2) 
When: Friday, 7 p.m. 
Where: Silver Eagle Stadium, 24 High School Drive, Egg Harbor Twp. 
Coaches: St. Augustine: Mark Reardon (4th season, 33-7); EHT: Kevin Stetser (2nd season, 8-7). 
Last week: St. Augustine kept its undefeated season intact with a 41-14 rout of Absegami on Oct. 16. Kyle Dobbins led the way, rushing for 182 yards and four touchdowns, while the defense held the Braves to negative-3 yards on the ground. … Egg Harbor Township is coming off its bye. The Eagles’ last game was a 19-7 setback to previously winless Ocean City on Oct. 9. 
Woodrow Wilson (4-2) at Cumberland (0-5) 
When: Friday, 7 p.m. 
Where: The Colt Corral, 90 Silver Lake Road, Seabrook 
Coaches: Woodrow Wilson: Preston Brown (1st season, 4-2); Cumberland: Tom Lake (10th season, 35-60). 
Last week: Woodrow Wilson stifled Schalick on Oct. 17, shutting out the Cougars 40-0. Jelani McCargo led the offense with 90 yards rushing and a score while Edwin Lopez added a TD on the ground and scored on a 75-yard punt return. … Cumberland is still searching for its first win after falling to Woodstown 36-7 on Oct. 16. The Colts snapped a nine-quarter touchdown drought when Yarneal Nock found the end zone with 2:58 left in the game, but that was too little, too late. 
Schalick (0-5) at Woodstown (4-2) 
When: Friday, 7 p.m. 
Where: 140 East Ave., Woodstown 
Coaches: Schalick: Seth Brown (11th season, 62-45); Woodstown: John Adams (6th season, 38-21). 
Last week: Schalick couldn’t get anything going in a 40-0 loss to Woodrow Wilson. The Cougars had just 98 yards of total offense, gave up six sacks and lost a pair of fumbles. … Woodstown took down Cumberland 36-7 thanks in part to Zaire Jones, who rushed for 124 yards and two touchdowns on just 10 attempts. James Parkell also went over the century mark, as he had 118 yards and a touchdown on the ground. Quarterback Chad Watt added two rushing TDs. 14 CONNECT 13 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://vineland.dj/1LPMvf4 TOP VIDEOS
